{{quote|...and the dews of Telperion and the rain that fell from Laurelin Varda hoarded in great vats like shining lakes, that were to all the land of the Valar as wells of water and of light.|''[[Quenta Silmarillion]]'', "[[Of the Beginning of Days]]"}}

The '''Wells of Varda''' were the great vats beneath the [[Two Trees]] in [[Valinor]] created by [[Varda]] to store the dew that fell from [[Laurelin]] and [[Telperion]].<ref>{{S|Days}}</ref> When the Valië knew that the [[Awakening of the Elves]] was near, she used the light from the vats of Telperion to create renowned [[stars]] and constellations.<ref>{{S|3}}</ref>

The Wells were drained by [[Ungoliant]] in the [[Darkening of Valinor]], and while drinking she grew to such a size that even [[Morgoth|Melkor]] feared her.<ref>{{S|Darkening}}</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'', the dew collected in the vats when the Trees waxes, was also needed to water the Trees when they waned. The watering of Laurelin was tended by Urwen ([[Arien]]), a maiden of [[Vána]]; and the watering of [[Silpion]] by 
[[Silmo]], a youth beloved by [[Irmo|Lórien]].<ref>{{LT1|III}}</ref>
